channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-5511] percentComplete returned by job status from WebHCat is null
item.description: In hadoop1 the logging from MR is sent to stderr. In H2, by default, to syslog. templeton.tool.LaunchMapper expects to see the output on stderr to produce 'percentComplete' in job status.
item.summary: percentComplete returned by job status from WebHCat is null

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: HIVE-5353 will need to be checked in before this patch applies cleanly
HIVE-5511.extra.patch additional changes
none of this is necessary if YARN-1294 is fixed
HIVE-5511.2.patch applies to trunk after HIVE-5133. This includes tests contributed by Deepesh Khandelwal

1. added ability to override hadoop(YARN) log4j properties
2. refactored LaunchMapper into 1st level class from a subclass of TempletonControllerJob to make code that runs in WebHCat JVM clearly separated from that which is run on arbitrary node in the cluster
3. cleaned up TrivialExecService/LaunchMapper to send logging info to 'syslog' using Log4j instead of System.err
4. cleaned up HDFSStorage a bit so that it doesn't pollute webhcat.log with useless exceptions when something (client getting job status) is looking for job status file has not been written yet.
Can you please add a reviewboard link?
Unfortunately not. There is something wrong with RB
https://secure.phabricator.com/D7348
actually https://reviews.facebook.net/D13563

Overall: +1 all checks pass

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12609086/HIVE-5511.3.patch

blocks HIVE-5547 since that patch needs to be applied first

previous comment should read:
blocks HIVE-5547 since this patch needs to be applied first

HIVE-5511.5.patch addresses
1. Thejas' comments
2. fixes percentComplete for Hive queries
3. adds a percent complete test for Hive

Overall: -1 at least one tests failed

Thanks for the contribution Eugene!
